intro: Argophyllum nitidum var. fulvum, commonly known as the golden sandmat, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in coastal areas. Due to its unique appearance and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
